attributes.action: Call for a Vote of No Confidence in the Government
attributes.additional_details:
The government pledged to:
•Strengthen and control the UK’s borders
•Reduce cost of living and increase household financial security
•Make streets safer and reduce crime
•Improve education and life opportunities for children.
To date, there has been a marked decline in all of these areas. These failures raise serious concerns about the government’s competence, credibility, and fitness to govern. Public trust has eroded, many citizens no longer feel represented or protected by those in power.
attributes.background: We call on Parliament to hold a vote of no confidence in His Majesty’s Government due to its repeated failure to deliver on key commitments made to the British people

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence. 
 
If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.
